posts.post_content:
Partial set break of 1899-00 M101 Sporting News Premiums.  Very tough cards to find not trimmed or altered.  The HOFers are listed individually on GSB: [url]http://www.grandslambids.com/shop.php?name=Matts-Cards&user_id=100001[/url]
Great biographical info on the back (e.g. "He taught school for six terms and is often called the 'schoolmaster' by his associates")

Non-HOFers are as follows:
Corcoran, Cincinatti P (heavy paper loss at top) $100
Criger, Cleveland P (paper loss at top) $100



Beaumont, Pittsburg P (heavy paper loss at top & side) $100 sold
Breitenstein, Cincinatti F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Cross, St Louis F (looks VG but 3 pin holes) $200 sold
Dahlen, Brooklyn F (looks VG but 4 tiny pin holes) $200 sold
De Montreville, Baltimore F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Donahue, Philadelphia P (significant paper loss at bottom) $75 sold
Donlin, St Louis F (looks VG but 4 tiny pin holes) $200 sold
Donovan, Pittsburg F (looks VG but 4 tiny pin holes) $200 sold
Dunn, Brooklyn F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Griffin, St. Louis F (bottom corner wear) $150 sold
Heidrick, St Louis F (pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Hughes, Brooklyn A (trimmed) $50 sold
Kennedy, Brooklyn F (4 pin holes) $150 sold
Leever, Pittsburg F (looks VG but 4 tiny pin holes) $200 sold
O'Conner, Cleveland P (paper loss at top corner and soiling) $100 sold
Peitz, Cincinatti F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Phillipe, Pittsburg F (looks VG but 4 tiny pin holes) $200 sold
Ritchey, Pittsburg P (edge & surface wear) $100 sold
Tenney, Boston F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Callahan, Chicago G (2 small pin holes at bottom) $200 sold
Hahn, Cincinatti F (looks VG but 4 tiny pin holes) $200 sold
Lewis, Boston F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Long, Boston F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Dinneen, Boston F (4 pin holes and edge wear) $150 sold
Scott, Cincinatti F (looks VG but 4 tiny pin holes) $200 sold
Williams, Pittsburg F (edge wear) $150 sold
Freeman, Boston F (corner wear) $150 sold
Jones, St Louis P (left edge damage) $100 sold
McGuire, Brooklyn P (paper loss at bottom) $100 sold

Matt:

PM sent on the McGinnity.

Thanks,

Phil

McGinnity scans added to the GSB listing.  Here are the Dahlen scans:

[IMG]https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-mQAhn4JLdqk/TkhgXyZwtZI/AAAAAAAAKY8/7e7PtyPZ5Rw/s800/PC0003004.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-ahuLbtlv11k/TkhgYrlKm5I/AAAAAAAAKZA/HkRPUyWGtH8/s800/PC0004005.jpg[/IMG]

In addition to the non-HOFers listed above, I have the following HOFers still available on GSB.  Many of these are the first reasonably collectible issues available for these HOFers:

Frank Chance RC
Jack Chesbro RC
George Davis
Elmer Flick RC
Clark Griffith
Billy Hamilton
Hughie Jennings RC
Joe McGinnity RC
John McGraw RC
Wilbert Robinson
Bobby Wallace RC
Vic Willis RC (Great Boston Uniform)
Cy Young RC

[url]http://www.grandslambids.com/shop.php?name=Matts-Cards&user_id=100001[/url]

Updated to reflect additional sales.  Feel free to make an offer on the remaining (and the HOFers on GSB)
